Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape with rounded base, two pierced cylindrical handles on shoulder and flat ledge rim. The exterior is decorated in purple paint with spirals of various sizes, and wavy lines on the handles and the rim top.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D67c in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. The shape and the painted design are meant to imitated of a stone vessel made of limestone breccia. The wavy lines on the handles may evoke the shimmer of gold foil, which was added to the more lavish stone vessels. Imitations of stone jars placed in graves would allow their owners to enjoy luxuries probably unattainable in their lifetime
